column5: I have checked around and all I can find is smelt that have been gutted/be-headed.  Does anyone know where I can score some smelt with heads in the Niagara area?
The smelts are starting to show up in the lower Grand River now if you want to catch some.

ive seen them at the fortinos around here, and price choppers as well  i was looking for them earlier on in the spring for ice-out pike...had seen them once and couldnt remember where.  months later i saw them at the 2 stores mentioned
Around here we find them in the rivers in the spring time..heads, tails, innards,,,and they are even alive.  A guy told me its illegal to sell whole smelts as bait...this true?

yeah as Dara said, I get a year's worth of smelt for free every spring.  You just gotta go stand in a river for a while.  Its iffy about the sale of smelt as bait because some places it;s ok to use as bait and in other places it's illegal.
even headless and gutted they are a great pike bait!!
Check out your local Food Basics in the frozen section.
Thanks again, I'm gonna call around and see what I can find.  If I have to, no heads it is
Yep.See them there all the time.
catch them through the ice in port colbourn by the hundreds lots of fun make great bait and taste great
